VKACXSlImNYzjMCt_aL-Hw.text: Adorable place. The people at the bar were hilarious. One guy couldn't resist talking to me and giving me anecdotes about crutches (which I was on at the time). Great potato appetizer.  Perfect location across from the museum!

ZMKd4_7x6H6KaC36kkbtPw.text: Quite a pleasant if rather small Victorian pub. Can get busy, primarily with tourists as opposite the British museum, so the friendly staff become hard pressed. Good selection of ales, especially the lovely Woodforde's Wherry.

nwDFx_CFXT1L4UBSB84HQw.text: Reading the reviews I agree with all of them, we visted the pub which is in the passport scheme and reasonably close to the dominian theatre. the weather was windy, freezing cold and snowing. it seemed warm inside but after sitting for a while you could soon feel the draught through the large gaps in the door and really misssed a log fire. I too felt the lack of customer service at the bar, there were 3 people behind there all huddled together and discussing the days takings or what ever, however after a while we were serviced welcomely and efficiently with good advice. The food was exceptional for pub grub and the 'London gold' was on good form. next round was the same issue the two barmaids were huddled together again and gave the immpresion we were blanked (as previous review), but when you had their attention things were great. We would visit again and we are able to reccomend to anybody thinking about visiting, as the food is good and the beer we had was also good 'London gold'. "Rating marked as a pub with grub"

aJEN859hEvzMr50d9GJc_w.text: I went to see this pub because I knew that Freud usually went here to drink something after work, so I was curious. It's a lovely pub near the British Museum. The quality and standard of service is preatty good. When I went in this pub there were many tourists that harmed the atmosphere because the pub was too busy. I think it's better to go at th Museum Tavern in the late afternoon or evening. A great place to visit in central london.

WMg3srSEFyfh0TbL3ADq6g.text: Although in a touristy location right across from the British museum, somehow feels intimate, cozy and local. Wonderful bartenders and service. And a great variety of beer. Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom

efz5-rPPgfh0zQFgoDwawQ.text: Great wee bar, atmospheric,  traditional and  despite being opposite the British Museum is not at all touristy.

P4v6AKyFzT3nV6pBy_rnMQ.text: The Cod Fish & Chips was great along with the malt vinegar! The fact that it's close to the British Museum was a plus! My family and I had lunch there and then went to the British Museum!

H-16Km318CeSq4t1hgGOiA.text: This is a chain of pubs that has a location right outside The British Museum, so it's a no-brainer to stop here for a pint or a delectable bite at lunch time after visiting the museum.Don't miss the great appetizer samplers or the treacle pudding with custard. Great selection of beers and spirits. Be aware the pub does NOT serve coffee or tea.The restrooms are a little tricky to get to: go towards the far end of the bar by the back and go down a spiral staircase (one person at a time).

Io-NEh9z8QLiN33orZW_-Q.text: This small pub opposite the British Museum has a delightful mid-Victorian interior, full of polished mahogany and etched mirrors and stained glass. Although there has been a pub on the site since the early 18th century: a tavern named the Dog and Duck was recorded here in 1723, although it may have sold liquor before that. The present name was adopted in 1862, after the Museum was built. The interior dates from a refit around 1855, by the architect William Finch Hill. Although refitted several times since, many of his elaborately carved woodwork fittings survive. The pub has a formidable choice of real ales which, on a recent visit, included Timothy Taylor, Fuller's London Pride, Theakston's Old Peculier, Sharp's Doom Bar, Golden Promise Organic, and Bombardier. Although I'd normally say this was a good thing, the quality of one or two of the ales wasn't tip-top  a couple fewer with faster turnover might be better. They do a range of traditional pub food, with the sausage and mash being recommended (though it is a while since I have eaten here). It gets very busy (and touristy) during the day when the museum is open, but is generally much quieter after 8pm, when you stand a chance of finding a seat. Toilets are all down steep stairs and are not accessible for those with impaired mobility. (I suppose you could always have a pint and nip across to the Museum itself, though the access is via self-operated chair lifts). The only real downside was the service: very efficient, but definitely without a smile. I presume this is something to do with being in such a touristy location  but a smile surely costs nothing? We weren't even wished good-night as we left

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom. Interior shot of Museum Tavern
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom. Exterior view of Museum Tavern - complete with rubbish bags and road works...

zBi2iYTxdLObUfj19UxlRQ.text: I am not a local but was looking for a pub to sit, eat and not be surrounded by a hundred wasted patrons. I eat somewhat late and find that a lot of the pub kitchens close pretty early. This was open and serving food at 10pm, they let me sit at a bar or a table and were very attentive and friendly.I have to say I didn't find it touristy at all. Based on the other reviews, I think it all depends on what time you come here. It IS directly across from the British Museum so I can see midday on a Saturday being annoying. But isn't that true if you're sober anywhere in central London at that time?Oh, also bonus free WiFi if you fill out that Cloud form. :)

Z3uRWaxA6XfGiS8stjEIMg.text: I like this place. It's got cosy feel to it, great staff, good food & a nice selection of ales. A nice green Stonehenge Luck of the Irish is on tap today  St. Patrick's Day. I'd definitely come back here! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom

q70LvblAsONS8UehVtqcYg.text: I lived nearby the Museum and found this place a nice hideaway from the hustle of Russell Square. Found this place quite helpful to finish homework and brainstorm ideas with friends. I like this joint, good vibes, great seating, awesome service. Give it a shot, I certainly did.

81XVoPw4X6VaofmrOEtbhg.text: Standard English pub. Good pub food. Good drinks. Good service. Decent prices. Won't be a "blow you out of this world" experience. You might think it's the best pub or the worst pub based off your experiences with them, but the one thing for sure is you will go in here and not leave under-fed or under-quenched if you so desire.

pGPAr7kKsQdH_s8LO5knvw.text: If you are looking for British classics, you could do worse than the Museum Tavern. I had the fish and chips. They were a bit bland but that is just the nature of fish and chips! The tavern has a classic old style feel with cramped but charming seating. The location is fantastic just across from the British Museum.

MJjy6s8KCl1xqlrJrhOKNw.text: Due to its location directly opposite the British Museum, The Museum Tavern caters almost exclusively to tourist and museum-goers.  As such it tends to play up its historic significance at every opportunity with old pictures and postcards adorning each surface, as well as assorted historical knick-knacks.  The bar itself is always full and cosy enough sporting comfortable seating and lots of old wood.  They also have a guidebook which tells you of a night Karl Marx spent drinking in this very establishment.I really couldn't stand this place and only stayed to gulp my pint as quickly as possible, it just reminds you of everything you hate about tourism.  The place has built itself on its supposed Britishness and its proximity to The British Museum to the extent that it has absolutely no atmosphere or soul to it.  On top of that its incredibly expensive in spite of the piss poor food and drinks on offer.It's impossible to ignore the touristy elements of this place, so if you're after an authentic drinking experience in London, avoid at all costs.

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom

CWpQ7_5GLxZ6YmAj4aD4Aw.text: Two visits in two days. Good pub food, nice staff. Quick to clear tables, expedite service, nice room. The very best of English pubs.

N1y9sN1We8MiV7Cnsv3UWQ.text: Had a great time here after several hours at the museum. My son and I grabbed a pint and had the ploughmans platter. The description on the menu was lacking but we like to live dangerously. It was lovely and went well with the beers we drank.

1q0F7OKzHM_SFQAjDGgJPA.text: I love this place because it is right across the street from the British museum, and after a day of hoofing it around looking at beautiful artifacts a place to sit and a decent priced beer helps so much. I mean its not the best food or anything, However I have had some of the best conversations I have ever had at a bar here. With a History professor from Leeds, and a Grad student studying Ancient Indian coins. We talked about History, beer and Rugby, Man I love England.

a5lZNsjIdMMagbWTN6xPvA.text: In the summer a friend of mine had a job as a supervisor at a language school. This meant he had to lead around kids in the teens. One day they came on a trip to London. Part of their schedule was to go to the British Museum. They were old enough to do their own thing so, in the meantime, we met for a drink. The pub is directly across the road from the Museum. It has large windows, is set across a large open plan room with quite a few tables and is handsome enough. The bar is on the far wall.  As one would expect the clientèle are generally people visiting the museum. We sat at a high table at the back, where we stayed for an hour. Though the bar is very generic, and not worth a diversion it is a pleasant enough place for a quick drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom

KsM9HjsFdSYdrzDx1TS2nw.text: This pub does rather an impressive selection of real ales. I didn't know half of them which is always a good sign. I think there were about half a dozen options. As an extra bonus the food board had suggestions for which drinks should go with which meals. It suggested ales and lagers to accompany your nosh. They have changed the layout sometime in the last year removing the big pews and large tables that could sit 6-8 people. This gives them more flexibility as tables can be moved around, but slightly less seating which can be missed. This pub can be quite busy due to its location so near to the British museum., but manages not to be a tourist trap fortunately.

JTsCf0z6M7bigPl9kWkh7A.text: A decent free house in central London. Seven casks on offer, a few interesting ones, including Old Peculier. Prices are a bit high for the beers on offer, but it's all about the location. Bartenders weren't that impressive, but whatever. It is a nice, old-fashioned-feeling pub with lots of big windows looking out on to the street and to the museum across the street. Worth checking out if you're in the area.

MM7TFH0Pl_avnnmRO8Vd2A.text: Visiting London, staying nearby, I probably had more drinks and dinners here than at any other local venue.  One of the oldest pubs in London, or so they say, they are pretty touristy (being across from the British Museum might be a factor there!).  Still, a sprinkling of locals, decent pub food/service, and a fine beer selection make this a near-guaranteed hit -- as long as it isn't too crowded.  Weekends are not as highly recommended for this reason.  Trivia: I watched Will's wedding on the TV here, so I will always remember this pub :-)

hl7PBg-l9YbR5EIx6LiePA.text: Tourist pub. But we enjoyed the Ploughmans Lunch and a pint or two. Near the museum, as the name says.

63OdKabUUqnoX0fBAeocOw.text: Not a bad interior - and much better than anything else in the immediate (and otherwise very touristy) area. The great plus point is the range of real ales, although I agree with dmj1962 that fewer with a faster turnover might improve beer quality. Although the service is all right, I did get the impression that they don't have to try too hard: it was perfectly quick and efficient, but when I asked for a top-up for a rather large head on the beer, the barman gave me the slightest extra possible - a quick flick on the hand pump with one finger, which I felt was a rather pointed gesture, and rather unnecessary. It's put me off rushing back.

XvN5S70W2DJKdvULXnnQdw.text: Great stop before or after visiting the museum! The fish and chips were delicious and a generous portion. Great old school pub atmosphere. :-( Bathrooms were out of toilet paper!

5VBYXtSvfoeTvCr_OZDWHA.text: This is an excellent pub just across from the British Museum. Nice atmosphere and friendly service. My granddaughter & I stopped in here and split a Pulled Pork Nachos for dinner. It was quite good; just perfect for us at the time.

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom. Pulled Pork Nachos.
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom

bpKsBfsKGmPe__1_-D1Zkw.text: I was very pleased with this pub on a recent crawl in the area. Several attendees were able to spend some time at the British Museum and come round for drinks later. We had a rather large group, but as usual, some arrived a bit later, so we were able to snag an entire section over time. The pub was a bit hot in temperature, but the management assured us the heating wasn't on, and we made do by taking off as many layers as possible and making sure to have some ice (though it didn't stay ice very long) water with our beers. When everyone is sweating through their shirt, it isn't as embarrassing as if you're doing it on your own. The selection of beers were quite good, and everyone in the group was able to find something to enjoy... even our Lager (bleh!) drinkers. :PThe atmosphere was good. Historic looking bar and decor, but with a lovely jovial feel to it. We really enjoyed this one, and with it's proximity to the British Museum, I would have expected many more tourists, so was pleasantly surprised not to. If you're in the area, do check out this pub. Heck, even if you're not, you might want to give this one a go.

V-OJOwVJA9yBarFMsnjl6A.text: What a find!Popped in after the Museum for a small bite, and before we knew it our small table was covered with food, glorious food!And the drinks on offer, oh, mulled wine! and ales and beers and so much more.Filled with tourists and locals, it's a lovely place to grab a tasty bite and relax just a bit.Enjoy!

lz1peD1hBZGDNlQthD5M8A.text: Spending a few hours exploring the British Museum works up quite a thirst.  Conveniently, there is a great pub right across the street.  I find myself in this pub every time I'm in town and always have a blast.  Bartenders are cool and help me out with the different beers to choose from, as they are all new to me.  This time around I was drinking Doom Bar.  What I love most is that I can pop in maybe once a year and still find pub regular Graham at the bar to catch up with over a few pints.  Until next time, cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom. Pints with Graham

LMNyAIzgW9UKkASGn-pNtg.text: Pretty standard pub with very good food. Fish & chips were served hot and crispy, and the steak & ale pie was delicious. Good selection of beers, and the people were friendly enough. Great way to unwind after a field-trip-ridden visit to the British Museum.

nZQDgUEN6QYMmYd7-AWpvg.text: Based on the positive reviews, my family opted for lunch at Museum Tavern after a morning at the British Museum.   The service was efficient and friend, but the food was closer to one star.  The fish and chips were fine but a bit bland. Everything else we ordered - burgers, sandwiches, had clearly been prepared elsewhere and assembled on-site. I suppose we should not have expected good quality so close to a major tourist destination like the BM.

j2Uef5aJ0wk4CQqmcPcczA.text: We stopped here after the British Museum and had a wonderful time. Very friendly staff, great ale and nice food.

xxTjtFb2tRA4JPuQtEvHHA.text: Okay, maybe not the nicest staff on the planet, but they have Crabbies mulled wine. I didn't know what this was before I came here and it's pretty much the only thing that will make me forget that I've walked 10 miles daily to see the city. Other than that, despite it's proximity to the British Museum (across the street), there are barely any tourists here and the places is relatively quiet. It's definitely a nice resting spot after seeing the sites and I feel like it's location deters most people from going in, which is why it's so peaceful and nice when you actually go in.

1B8B6ngzz71CDasXPKG3wA.text: All around fast and very welcoming place. The calamari is delicious and the fish and chips is perfectly crispy on the outside and nice and tender inside. Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom. Yummy fries

5IMNbo-cw-3KoxlpD4hVpA.text: Maybe it was the time of night we went, but I didn't find it touristy at all.  One of my British co-workers had a CAMRA guide and this pub was in it.  It is conveniently located across from the British Museum.  Most of the group just wanted drinks, but there were a couple of us who had not had dinner, so we were hoping for some food.I can't remember what time we showed up, but the waitress allowed us to order some food, however we had limited options since they were closing up the kitchen.  My friend had a tuna sandwich and I had the Nachos.  The Nachos were pretty good.  The selection of ales were nice and the staff were helpful.  It can be difficult to find seats when it gets busy.  I really enjoyed the place...  I even got to meet Mark Addy!

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom. Inside the pub... and yes that is Mark Addy

2PJtQmZZME-PWqfxO3U_UQ.text: Nice and friendly pub near the museum where you can actually get food on a Sunday.Food: A very generous offering of fish, chips and various sauces.  All were well prepared and had good flavor.  No complaints.Drink: seemed to have a pretty large selection of ales on tap and pull.Service: After trying to get pub food in a number of other places on our walk home it became clear that pubs do not serve food on Sunday (news to us).  We were alerted to the possibility that Museum Tavern did serve and arrived a few minutes past 9.  We were told that they stopped serving food at 9 but after a small negotiation, they made an exception for us.  The servers and bartender were all friendly and helpful.Location: It seems to draw in quite a few tourists as the museum is nearby and there are a number of hotels in the area.Decor: it had just enough Victoriana to suit my image of pub life.Recommendation: pop in for a bite and beer.....particularly on Sunday

ios83mht7YRbdHGZElnM_A.text: Always a great place in London to eat and drink.  If you are going to the Tavern between 6 PM and 8 PM be prepaired to stand . . . the Museum Tavern is not large, and it is quite popular so acquiring a table could be a challenge.

JwUn_fJxDtdnpYgtb2AIvQ.text: Genuine oldy victorian pub opposite the museum selling good British food and genuine real ale . Lots of polished dark wood and leather seating . Beer quality good though limited and a little pricey .

DG4ZbON9VvL3mEhf1Gv_cg.text: Only referring to the food: Looks better than it taste. Ordered the steak and ale pie. Came out picture perfect and piping hot. The pie crust was flaky but tastes like refrigerator/freezer.  The steak inside had that old, cooked-more-than-36-hours ago- reheated, flavor. I'm pretty sure that the meat was the leftovers of yesterday's (more like two days ago) roast beef, which was just cut-up and used as the filling. It's my first time eating this english classic dish, but I know what it's not supposed to taste like.  The people are really nice, but that's about it.

MR9BFO0nBCFyH3ML-yM7oA.text: Being this close to the Museum I expected lackluster food and service given the captive audience.  However the fish n chips and even their burgers are with the hundred paces to leave the artifacts.   Pricing is reasonable and portions are generous.  Clientele is predominantly locals and plentiful.  You might have to wait to get a table.  Seating is intimate and limited.   Only complaint is their offering of Pepsi.  :(

g1KcoVMJJ4zcjIBopB2bQQ.text: Great place for lunch when visiting the British Museum, it's literally directly across the street.  A few tables outside, but the interior is comfortable and relaxing with a huge bar and ample number of tables.  Philip had their Ultimate Fish and Chips and was quite a fan.  I had the steak and whiskey pie and it was quite good (though I still prefer Guinness in a pie!).  Friendly staff, reasonable prices, great locale.

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom. Mid-afternoon at the Museum Tavern.
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom. Mmmm... pie....
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom. Ultimate Fish and Chips

XokZ6eRLMz-RHER8t2gwcA.text: One of my favorite pubs in London. Friendly bar staff. They make great recommendations. Also really enjoyed the food. Great location.

sbQFsNxMk0ssB8oT0jSgTw.text: Great pub friendly,efficient staff that processed our order with a smile. Excellent range of real ales which is a bonus if your a camra member as you get 10% off a pint.Can get busy, but hay its opp the British Museum, so get to the bar early, order a pint an wait for a table. CheersDavid

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom

BsuMlthRMb-9PF2dxDSqvQ.text: What a fun place! I actually met Americans like me there! The bartenders are so friendly & full of advice & info! One waiter room about 10 minutes of his time to tell us about tourism. So much appreciated & informational! Drinks are great as are appetizers. Probably going back tomorrow!

2DzCzrj0yHgGpzC4_5zA9A.text: i generally prefer more modern takes on fish and chips.this was a good version of the traditional type.fish was good.  the batter was light.  it was not too heavy.chips were good.  tartar sauce was good.liked the extra curry sauce.mushy peas were good.cider was good.service was good.

rv-71M708C2m-NxN_lHm3Q.text: Right across the street from the British Museum. Felt very touristy so I ordered fish & chips, which were delicious. Price was pretty good for where I was and what I got.

3ZF0wY7m86qraAXMv0XlNA.text: The Museum Tavern is a Greene King (formerly Taylor-Walker) pub opposite of the British Museum - as such, it's a good place to wind down after a stressful visit to the always over-crowded exhibitions. Fortunately, it's also one of the better Greene King pubs, with a larger than usual range of hand-pumped ales and lagers, friendly staff, and solid (if streamlined) food at only slightly elevated prices. Despite the popular location, the Museum Tavern is no tourist trap. You will also find the décor of this historic pub to be pleasant and cozy, so it can be considered a place to linger with your friends or family. There are rather few other pubs nearby, none of them as good as this one - so I recommend it strongly.

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom

TOqgevzAnLDKkMsULnlMnQ.text: We enjoyed dinner at the Museum Tavern, located right across the street from the British Museum. Tables can be booked in advance (by telephone or online), which we did. Our table was waiting, a good move as the pub was crowded. (There is outside seating, but the rain was not conducive to it this evening.) Despite it being in a heavily visited and touristed location, I would say that predominately locals were here after work. The wooden bar and fittings give it the perfect British pub atmosphere. Recommended to other visitors to London.I placed our food order at the bar and it was served at our table. I ordered the Ultimate Fish and Chips. A nice cod fillet was accompanied by mushy peas, pickled onions, curry sauce and tartar sauce. It was very good!The Museum Tavern is something of a museum itself. The pub dates to 1723 and has operated under its present name since 1755. The present building dates to 1855.

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom. Museum Tavern.
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom. Museum Tavern historical plaque.
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom. Ultimate Fish and Chips.

ywMLI-nO1HW31yKFTiXRYg.text: We came here late one night to eat.  It is a very small restaurant so I can't imagine if it was busy what it would be like. We seated ourselves and then I grew annoyed with a sign that said "order at the bar" because this was first described to me as a place you could sit down.  However, a waitress did end up coming over to us and taking our food order, even giving us a specific time of when it would be ready. The inside of this place is extremely cute. It has a nice vibe and there were a lot of people standing around and drinking that seemed to be regulars that enjoyed this place. I ended up getting the Hunter's Chicken which was Grilled chicken breast topped with smoked streaky bacon, Cheddar cheese & BBQ sauce. Served with chips, onion rings, house coleslaw and a dressed salad garnish.  This meal was done well.  I enjoyed that it came with chips and onion rings and the prices were very reasonable.  We also tried the Louisiana Burrito which was a tortilla wrap filled with grilled seasoned vegetables, mixed beans and chillies with coriander & parsley rice, infused with smoked paprika, garlic, oregano & lemon. Mixed with crisp lettuce, mature Cheddar cheese & sour cream. It also came with some very good crisps. I then wanted to get dessert to go, which seemed like a foreign concept for the waitress.  She asked what I wanted and I told her Apple Crumble and she said that would be fine.  Once we paid and I got the Apple Crumble we left.  I did not look at the Apple Crumble until I got back and when I did it looked absolutely disgusting and like someone else had already eaten it.  That got thrown away fairly quickly. Overall, a  nice place for a pub.  Very small cute decorations, average food.

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom

vrmB8bDEy07xre7ZiEAfgg.text: Great place for a pint or for the BEST fish & chips in London! Reviews don't do this place justice.  It is small but everything I imagined in a pub in London.  Short walk from the British Museum.  Super friendly server and it was packed and our food came out fast and hot!  Chicken and mushroom open face sandwich was a hit but the real crowd pleaser was the fresh hot and huge order of fish and chips! Cooked perfectly with a light and crunchy batter made it by far the best in town!  Cold beer hot food friendly staff they earned a 5 star review.

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom

V_-8oxQw8MWyfrpTev0ORg.text: I am not hyping this when I say that this was LITERALLY the BEST fish and chips I've ever had. I've had my fair share of fish and chips from places all over California and in Ireland. This place is literally right across the British museum and after being so hungry I was so glad I found this place. The place was however, extremely busy and there was literally only one waitress taking care of over 50+ people and their orders. Which I didn't understand why there was only one person. But me and my friend patiently waited and was seated within 10 minutes or so.Before coming in we both saw the ultimate fish and chips plate and agreed that it was what we were ordering. It comes with a large fried fish, lots of chips, peas, bread and butter and curry and tartar sauce.First of all I was just impressed with how much was on the plate. And I've never had curry sauce with fish and chips and boy was it delicious! The fish was AMAZING. Fried to perfection to say the least. It wasn't soggy and the fish had the perfect seasoning too. The chips were crispy on the outside and well done on the instead. The peas were a good compliment with all the fried food being stuffed into my mouth. I couldn't have been more pleased.Come here. You won't regret the 15£.

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom

hV6ltBer0ok9XggEnwGy7Q.text: Just what I expected to find when I walked into this British Tavern. Lots if dark wood, tapestry curtains over windows, frosted glass. Beers were cold, cant ask more that that! The wait staff was attentive.We ordered a meal of fish and chips and found the serving of fish to have a cold center.

W9L2_UT3PCe5NFDc8Kockw.text: Very close to the British Museum. It was a lot smaller than I expected inside. It seemed to be filled with mainly tourists, but there were a couple locals at the bar. The signs say to grab a table anywhere. Our waitress was very kind. She explained the different ciders to me. The menu is pretty diverse from fish and chips to burritos. I had the lamb shank shepherds pie. It was hot and comforting on this particular cold day. The gravy on the side was rich and delicious. The peas and carrots on the side I could've done without. The prices are very fair. I was expecting them to be a little more with the proximity to the museum, but was pleasantly surprised.

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom. Just a few of their many drafts
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom. Aspall Cyder

E5_DRFAfxEGk0J5UUttunA.text: If you are anywhere near this place you have to stop in for the fish n chips. These are the best I've had in London. The service was top notch also!  The pints are cold and people are warm.

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom. A cold brew with great fish is as England as it gets.

8CmqpeCOJvk2fkkSooixDw.text: This place is definitely worth the visit. I don't know what old time London feels like, but I like to think it might be a little bit like stepping into Museum tavern. This place is exactly what I think of when I imagine having a pint in a British pub. The Cod and chips could have been more flavorful, but the price is right so who am I to complain? Not to mention they have some pretty good stuff on tap and weren't at all offended when I decided to order a water instead. I would probably make a stop in to this place the next time I am in London, if for no other reason than its authentic pub aesthetic.

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom

J4rLLyVCJFjMLHdKT4VRPg.text: Great food and a great atmosphere! I tried the fish and chips and it was delicious. Freshly made, piping hot served with peas, bread and 2 sauces. The Mac and cheese is a must do, made with a white aged British cheddar. They had a nice variety of music playing, but not too loud so you could have a conversation. Be careful of the windy staircase to the restrooms if you've had a few ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom

x_TEBovqcvb1aUZi7T4oqQ.text: Classic fish & chips. Crispy and delicious. Better than another version we tried the next day at another establishment that had won awards for their version.

p84E69syxBNY3fHlTTanQg.text: Good selection of beer on tap and I thoroughly enjoyed the Porter. Fish and chips we're cooked to perfection, and the green peas we're also good. Good ambiance inside and seating available outside. Courteous staff make this a good choice.

MpsSdDRg44AzAsiNPuDx9A.text: I assumed that Museum Tavern would be an expensive place to grab lunch due to its proximity to the British Museum, but luckily I was wrong. The prices were on par with other places I visited for lunch in London. The place isn't anything special, but the food was good and the service was friendly and quick. Their mac and cheese was surprisingly delicious, so that earned them a fourth star.

7lOf0spsp5f17LFZfBTVhQ.text: We used yelp for suggestions to eat around the British Museum, and this was the closest and moderately reviewed. We were craving "fish and chips" and cider so this was a win-win. The staff is friendly and fast. Portion of food is average. I'd eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom. The ultimate fish and chips with refreshing bottles of cide
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom

tAQbkMyv_CwYtRU9sZcCZw.text: Horrible service with no smile and rude attitude. The flavor was bland. Never go there.

eingW2JjxfcUaSyXJqvF0A.text: A charming English pub right across from the British Museum. Besides the great location, you can also expect excellent food and service. We ordered the Steak and Ale Pie, which was wonderful, and the sausage and mash, also quite good.  Along with a great selection of beers, you can't go wrong here.

photos.caption: Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Museum Tavern - Bloomsbury, London, United Kingdom

CGoxR461KONHn6sjSQLutA.text: Was expecting a really touristy place so close to the British Museum, but was pleasantly surprised.  Great selection of beers, food was good and service was quick.  Place was crowded when we got there, but a very pleasant atmosphere.

WiYjhpCI7D79D5HNaWi1vw.text: Museum Tavern is a classic English gastropub, with proper beer selection and traditional food. We ordered fish & chips and were served solid servings by friendly staff with good knowledge of their draught and bottled brew.
